meanings.definition: To utter a series of quick, high-pitched sounds
meanings.sent1: The birds were chippering happily in the trees.
meanings.sent2: I could hear the chippering of crickets in the garden at night.
meanings.sent3: The chippering of the squirrel sounded like a tiny concert in the park.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter filled the room, chippering like a melody.
meanings.sent5: The chippering of the wind through the leaves was soothing.

meanings.definition: A series of quick, high-pitched sounds
meanings.sent1: The chippering of the birds added a cheerful tune to the morning.
meanings.sent2: The chippering of the machine indicated it was working properly.
meanings.sent3: The chippering of the rain on the roof sounded like a gentle drumroll.
meanings.sent4: The chippering of the excited children filled the classroom.
meanings.sent5: The chippering of the squirrel made me smile as I walked in the park.

meanings.definition: To speak in a lively and cheerful manner
meanings.sent1: She chippered about her day with enthusiasm.
meanings.sent2: The children chippered excitedly about the upcoming field trip.
meanings.sent3: Grandma chippered on the phone, sharing stories from her youth.
meanings.sent4: His chippering voice lifted everyone's spirits in the room.
meanings.sent5: The chippering of the radio host kept the listeners engaged.
